w:r.w:t: They will work on basic skills line underlining and circling on the screen. They will learn to follow commands like sitting down, clapping, and listening. Ideally this will be a fun lesson to boost the student’s confidence and get them excited about their English lessons.

-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson
oduce yourself and encourage the student to respond in greeting.
Depending on age of student use a stuffed animal or puppet to greet the student.
Visual cue: draw a line on a whiteboard or the screen and say draw a line.
Allow the student to practice on the screen.
Draw a line from the ball to the kite.
Encourage the student to draw a line from the ball to the kite.
Use TPR to motion drawing a line.
Draw a circle on the screen.
Have the student draw a circle.
Visual cue: Write your own name on the
screen or on a piece of paper while saying: “My name is….”
Student practices writing their name on the screen.
TPR: Show circling in the air.
Instruct student to circle the flower.
I circle the flower,” depending on the level of the student.
If you have a doll or stuffed animal show them sitting down and standing back up.
by standing up off your chair
Make it fun by quickly standing up and sitting back down.
Visual cue: If you have a stuffed animal or a puppet use it to stand up and sit down.
Ask student to circle the up arrow. Ask the student to circle the down arrow.
TPR: Clap your hands and say clap.
Clap out a pattern or beat, have the student repeat after you.
Show listening by cupping your ear saying: “listen”
Encourage student to follow the action.
Ask student to circle the child who is listening.
Visual cue: Write your name on the screen and then clap out your own name.
If the student has an English name or can spell it with English letters clap out their name together.
Ask the student to circle the sun.
Student repeats: “I circle,” or “I circle the sun.”
Visual cue: Draw a line on a whiteboard.
Draw a line in the air
Ask the student to draw a line between the sun and flower.
Review some of the new words learned: listen, clap, sit down, stand up
Draws a line and makes a circle.
Draw a line and circle. Allow student to practice on the screen.
